description: From Middle English ladyship; equivalent to lady +â€Ž -ship.

entries.meaning: Term of respect for a woman of the peerage without using her title.
examples: "Her ladyship will be unable to attend tonight," he said, with a wink because he hadn't said why.

entries.meaning: (English and Commonwealth) Formal form of address for a lady judge (as opposed to the informal "judge").
